urls.title: Hematology | American Society of Hematology
urls.description: The Hematology ASH Education Program 2022 provides review articles from the Education Program at the 2022 ASH Annual Meeting. In this publication, each chapter relates to a different session presented at the meeting, spanning the spectrum from basic discovery and disease pathogenesis to the clinical application at the bedside. This activity is supported by educational grants from AstraZeneca; GlaxoSmithKline; Incyte Corp.; Jazz Pharmaceuticals, Inc.; Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp.; and Novartis Pharmaceuticals

urls.title: Quantifying the Erlenmeyer flask deformity. | Semantic Scholar
urls.description: Unlike diagnostic assignments based on subjective review, this simple procedure for identifying the modelling deformity is based on robust quantitative measurement and should facilitate comparative studies between different groups of patients, and may allow more rigorous exploration of the pathogenesis of the complex osseous manifestations of Gaucher's disease to be undertaken. OBJECTIVE Erlenmeyer flask deformity is a common radiological finding in patients with Gaucher's disease; however, no definition of this deformity exists and the reported prevalence of the deformity varies widely. To devise an easily applied definition of this deformity, we investigated a cohort of knee radiographs in which there was consensus between three experienced radiologists as to the presence or absence of Erlenmeyer flask morphology. METHODS Using the presence or absence of Erlenmeyer flask morphology as a benchmark, we measured the diameter of the femur at the level of the physeal scar and serially at

data.text:
An unusual cause of splenomegaly and pancytopenia  in an adult!

Think back to chemistry class and look at that femur...

I have seen a few of these so yes you need to know it.  And yes this can present in adults!

https://t.co/ahkx3EXP79 https://t.co/Kj7amRys98
@ManniMD1 @HiraSMian Epic in box empty no more clinic.   Don’t be jealous.
@VPrasadMDMPH @MichaelJSlade @CyclingDoctor @LabFehniger @DiPersioLab @ManniMD1 @DavidSteensma @bdermanmd @VincentRK @myelomaMD @Geoff_Uy Obviously
@JReinerMD Yes mask at the meeting but take off at the after party at the bar.

@JKanerMD @Dr_AmerZeidan The 60 vs 90 question was never answered definitively in my opinion. I much prefer these studies then numerous redundant phase 2 studies that usually don’t even reinforce my practice.  Both of you I look forward to seeing at ASH
@ManniMD1 @iStopMM @sykristinsson can you send me the talk?

urls.title: Paper: Single Versus Double Induction with “7+3” Containing 60 Versus 90 Mg Daunorubicin for Newly Diagnosed AML: Results from the Randomized Controlled SAL Dauno-Double Trial
urls.description: Program: Oral and Poster Abstracts Type: Oral Session: 615. Acute Myeloid Leukemias: Commercially Available Therapies, Excluding Transplantation and Cellular Immunotherapies: New Approaches to Combination Chemotherapy and Venetoclax Plus Hypomethylating Agent Therapy in AML Hematology Disease Topics & Pathways: adult, Clinical Practice (Health Services and Quality), Combination therapy, Therapies, therapy sequence, Study Population, Human Christoph Röllig, MD, MSC 1 *, Björn Steffen, MD 2 *, Christoph

data.text:
#ASH22 Practice Changers

Amazing study by team leukemia!

2 questions in 1 trial!

Newly diagnosed AML fit patients

Induction daunorubicin 90 mg/m2 = 60 mg/m2!

A 2nd induction with anthracycline not needed in responders.

Daunorubicin dose = 60 mg/m2!

https://t.co/pQ1sZbIV0g https://t.co/jeBqaap1mG https://t.co/FLIlPqnyjy
@ManniMD1 well that's because they didn't use isatuximab

#ASH22 

Is anyone as eager as me for the release of the ASH 2022 Education Book!?

Hopefully they bring back the print edition as I always enjoyed reading it on my trip home and then cover to cover when I got home. https://t.co/MzdOs6IcYM
@chadinabhan @BloodAdvances @ASkarbnik @GuiperiniMD Whatever @ASkarbnik says I’ll do the opposite.
RT @marklewismd: Of the many miseries endured by patients  in the hospital one of them is the needlessly restrictive diet 👇🏻 p.o. > ANC
@ManniMD1 Not that I do much allo for myeloma. I do for primary plasma cell leukemia in young patient who understands the risks.
@ManniMD1 But perhaps the only true cure?
@acweyand @AleckAmalia I can’t spell.  “There”
@acweyand Per @AleckAmalia Cafe Du Monde.  I will be going their daily.
@dgermain21 @PapaemmanuilLab @ash22 Look forward to meeting you in person my friend!
@Abdallah81MD Solid plan
@PapaemmanuilLab @ash22 I’ll be there!

#ASH22 Practice Changers

Time to abolish for good the neutropenic diet!
Let patients with cancer eat what ever they want even if neutropenic.

RCT in HSCT or induction chemo pts
Randomized 1:1 to standard diet or protective diet.

No difference in infections! https://t.co/sKNJ3DN7sU https://t.co/ewKqTmAQ1u

@ASkarbnik @matthew_mei @GuiperiniMD @paulocruzphi If we are discussing best Beatles albums the order is as following 

1. White album
2. Revolver
3. Sgt Peppers
4. Abbey Road
5. Rubber soul
6. Magical mystery tour
7. Let it Be
8. Beatles for sale
9. With the Beatles

urls.title: Perils of Ignoring Overall Survival in Interpreting the Myeloma Literature - PubMed
urls.description: Perils of Ignoring Overall Survival in Interpreting the Myeloma Literature

data.text:
Perils of Ignoring Overall Survival in Interpreting the Myeloma Literature - PubMed

⁦@ManniMD1⁩ 
⁦@drkevinknopf⁩  https://t.co/kfx3VK1WJs
@matthew_mei @ASkarbnik @GuiperiniMD I’ll be there Thursday through Monday.  Text me when you get in

@matthew_mei @GuiperiniMD @ASkarbnik Triangle you take a pill and you might not need auto and expect similar remission.   SHINE you take a pill and delay time to taking pill without removing other therapy.  3 vs 2 like a myeloma trial.

@matthew_mei @GuiperiniMD @ASkarbnik This study gets rid of one toxic therapy (auto) and replaces with something else.  SHINE just adds therapy we know works.

Neither are truly practice changing if you read my attached tweet although this study better than SHINE which just confirmed the obvious.

@davideyoungmd I do not use HyperCVAD for MCL

LAtely I have been using BR alternating with R-HiDAC or just BR on its own
@matthew_mei Did you know in SHINE ibrutinib maintenance delayed time to starting ibrutinib.

RT @AaronGoodman33: I will be sharing over next few days #ASH22 abstracts that are practice changing for me! 

BMTCTN 1703 by legendary bas…

RT @AaronGoodman33: #ASH22 Practice Changers

E1910 @MartinTallman

Ph- B-ALL (30-70 yo) 
BFM-like induction [PEG if<55 yo,ritux if CD20+]…

RT @ManniMD1: #ASH22 starts this week.

Here is a list of top 10 abstracts that have already influenced my thought and practice in myeloma!…

I do not know if this will change my practice as ibrutinib maintenance is no walk in park, but will have long discussion with patient about approaches.

Also FFS not best endpoint, and OS all the same, but its good to know ASCT can be omitted.

#ASH22 Practice Changers

Triangle study!

Frontline Mantle Cell
Transplant eligible

3 arms*
RCHOP/DHAP + ibrutinib->I maint
RCHOP/DHAP + I->ASCT->I maint
RCHOP/DHAP->ASCT
*ritux maint allowed

FFS equal in ibrutinib arms regardless of ASCT or not

Can 🚫ASCT if ibrutinib used https://t.co/btoPwYi8KK https://t.co/pG7exZwa7f
My smoldering myeloma treatment guidelines!
@VPrasadMDMPH Are you the discuss any at #ASH22 this year?  Would be interesting and educational.

@VPrasadMDMPH awesome, maybe you will be invited to the IMWG next?  I hope so.  I think in person people will realize we are all on the same team (how to best help our patients) we just have different approaches, we can all learn from each other
@ManniMD1 @Optum Yea DM is just so they look like they care for all of a second

urls.title: Are Observational, Real-World Studies Suitable to Make Cancer Treatment Recommendations?
urls.description: Kumar et al1 added a new chapter to a decades-long debate about whether observational studies—nonrandomized comparative effectiveness research (CER)—can replace randomized clinical trials (RCTs) to assess the efficacy of therapies. Their work is timely. The 21st Century Cures Act has empowered the...

urls.title: Use of the Word “Cure” in the Oncology Literature - Vinay Prasad, 2015
urls.description: Purpose: “Cure” is an important word in oncology but its use in the published literature has not been examined. I investigated all oncology articles using cure ...

tweets.text:
Cure means, after a fixed course of therapy, you have the same survival as age sex matched controls

It doesn't mean MRD neg while taking many drugs, costing 600,000 a year, for the rest of your life, years and years, without proof of OS gain

#ash22

https://t.co/JtAniP8cy7
First #ASH22 adventure: my checked bag was overweight because of all the protein I packed to consume over the next few days. Still gotta hit the macros when on the road. 😂🏋️‍♀️💪

@chadinabhan @AaronGoodman33 @Nirvana @ASkarbnik @sghmd @DocsWhoRock @montypal @AleckAmalia @DrRanaMcKay I now have 🎶 I’m so happy 🎶 in my head.

Worse ways to start the day.

How Aaron can utterly disparage Pearl Jam but like the cheap knockoff wannabe PJ Stone Temple Pilots is beyond me, tbh.

🤫🥳

This does not, however, answer relevant clinical ?’s like the ones I outlined in my responses.

Multiple Myeloma and Plasma Cell Dyscrasias: Clinical and Epidemiological: Poster II Hematology Disease Topics & Pathways: Research, Biological therapies, Clinical Research, health outcomes research, Therapies, Transplantation 1 Mayo Clinic Alix School of Medicine, Rochester, MN 2 Mayo clinic college of medicine, Rochester, MN 3 Division of Hematology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN 4 Division of Hematology, Department of Internal Medicine, Mayo Clinic, Rochester

tweets.text:
Good reminder of limited role of allogenic transplant in multiple myeloma- Mayo Clinic experience

N=89
Long term survival in less than 20%
By 2 years, 75% pts either progressed or died

Caveat:most patients at relapse, not 1st remission

https://t.co/TRmA2IIBMa

#mmsm 
#ASH22 https://t.co/KDYAfJRqgU
@acweyand Per @AleckAmalia Cafe Du Monde.  I will be going their daily.
But seriously, the most important questions re: #ASH22 are where are the best beignets in New Orleans and how many times a day is acceptable to eat them?
@AaronGoodman33 @PapaemmanuilLab @ash22 Same!

When a recommendation from a knowledgeable oncologist to treat a myeloma patient with maintenance using Daratumumab alternating with Isatuximab (to overcome 1q and decrease the incidence of resistance)! Then all I have to say this is a different level of BS! #mmsm

#ASH22 Practice Changers

Triangle study!

Frontline Mantle Cell
Transplant eligible

3 arms*
RCHOP/DHAP + ibrutinib->I maint
RCHOP/DHAP + I->ASCT->I maint
RCHOP/DHAP->ASCT
*ritux maint allowed

FFS equal in ibrutinib arms regardless of ASCT or not

Can 🚫ASCT if ibrutinib used https://t.co/btoPwYi8KK https://t.co/pG7exZwa7f
@matthew_mei @GuiperiniMD @paulocruzphi Don’t mind @GuiperiniMD , he only pretends he knows music, while thinking that Eagles is the best band ever.
@ASkarbnik @AaronGoodman33 @GuiperiniMD Either of you guys there on Thurs?

@matthew_mei @GuiperiniMD @ASkarbnik This study gets rid of one toxic therapy (auto) and replaces with something else.  SHINE just adds therapy we know works.

Neither are truly practice changing if you read my attached tweet although this study better than SHINE which just confirmed the obvious.
@GuiperiniMD @ASkarbnik @AaronGoodman33 Haha -- yeah, SHINE got trashed and this is plenary.  Make it make sense
@AaronGoodman33 Where does HyperCVAD / HDmtx-HD-cyt factor in?  Is that better than the outpatient recipe, or the same?  And what about other BTK inhibitors that "may" be safer than Ibrutinib?

urls.title: Bendamustine or high-dose cytarabine-based induction with rituximab in transplant-eligible mantle cell lymphoma
urls.description: Key Points. R-B with ASCT and MR is a feasible first-line strategy for younger, transplant-eligible patients with MCL.R-B with ASCT and MR achieves outcomes com

tweets.text: @AaronGoodman33 And BR + ASCT looks similar to R-CHOP / R-DHAP + ASCT ... by the transitive property then BR + ibrutinib wins right?  So SHINE after all?  (Btw this is in jest obviously)  https://t.co/KQS9Cxbfig

urls.title: Paper: Post-Transplant Cyclophosphamide, Tacrolimus, and Mycophenolate Mofetil As the New Standard for Graft-Versus-Host Disease (GVHD) Prophylaxis in Reduced Intensity Conditioning: Results from Phase III BMT CTN 1703

AL Malki, MD 4, Lyndsey Runaas, MD 5 *, Hany Elmariah, MD, MS 6, Andrew R. Rezvani, MD 7, Mahasweta Gooptu, MD 8, Karilyn T. Larkin, MD 9, Brian C. Shaffer, MD

tweets.text:
I will be sharing over next few days #ASH22 abstracts that are practice changing for me! 

BMTCTN 1703 by legendary bassist @sghmd 

RIC sib/MUD allo
Peripheral blood donor
PTCy/Tac/MMF vs Tac/MTX 

1-yr GRFS 52.7% for PTCy vs 34.9%
⬇️acute+chronic GVHD! 

https://t.co/2MZgWt2YNT https://t.co/4UvkuJsdY2

urls.title: Paper: Consolidation Therapy with Blinatumomab Improves Overall Survival in Newly Diagnosed Adult Patients with B-Lineage Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia in Measurable Residual Disease Negative Remission: Results from the ECOG-ACRIN E1910 Randomized Phase III National Cooperative Clinical Trials Networ
urls.description: Program: General Sessions Session: Late-Breaking Abstracts Session Hematology Disease Topics & Pathways: ALL, Biological therapies, Lymphoid Leukemias, Clinical Practice (Health Services and Quality), Bispecific Antibody Therapy, Diseases, Therapies, Lymphoid Malignancies 1 Division of Hemat ology, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, MN 2 Dana-Farber Cancer Institute, Boston, MA 3 Cancer Center, Montefiore Medical Center, Bronx, NY 4 Carbone Comprehensive Cancer Center, Madison, WI 5 Adult Hematologic Malignancies &

tweets.text:
#ASH22 Practice Changers

E1910 @MartinTallman

Ph- B-ALL (30-70 yo) 
BFM-like induction [PEG if<55 yo,ritux if CD20+]

s/p intensification MRD-(<0.01%) randomized to blinatumomab+chemo vs chemo
Blina arm superior OS

My practice = blina for MRD+ and MRD-

https://t.co/SMATmfygre https://t.co/sKerPuX21E https://t.co/fiIEslO14i

#ASH22 starts this week.

Here is a list of top 10 abstracts that have already influenced my thought and practice in myeloma! Look forward to hearing more about these and other studies at the meeting!

#mmsm https://t.co/mmiGmXbiUG
@AaronGoodman33 Cancer groups would be stronger if they actually addressed some of the legitimate criticism about the high price, and skewed research agenda. Hope they do!

urls.title: What Questions are Current Myeloma Trials NOT Answering | Invited Talk to UK Myeloma Research Day
urls.description: A link to our paper that I didn't mention but should havehttps://ashpublications.org/blood/article/137/4/456/474255/Persistent-challenges-with-treating-multi...

tweets.text:
It was great to get this feedback from the packed auditorium for the UK Myeloma Research day👇👇

Because of the magic of technology, you can watch the lecture they heard! 

In case interested, I would be happy to debate any of the arguments in the vid
https://t.co/bVnafQJHvg https://t.co/kGzDBr3xog

You were right @AaronGoodman33 

The DM was pure optics- nothing productive came out of it. @Optum took the weekend off, while our patients with cancer stayed in a limbo about whether their necessary treatment would be approved or not. https://t.co/WtFwkcYCg1

Looking for an A+  hematology clinician investigator job in Boston?  We would love to hear from you. Graduating fellows welcome. 

https://t.co/lZqeaSsSto

 For residents considering heme/onc fellowship, our section needs hospitalists!  Great mentoring 

https://t.co/ReQtvLr9PM
@AaronGoodman33 Let us know how it is once you’re done! I’ve been wanting to read it
@AaronGoodman33 I take responsibility for recommending it. I love the book. And if people disagree i am happy to debate them.

urls.title: Clinical Commentary: Dose Reduction of Selinexor in Relapsed Patients With Multiple Myeloma
urls.description: At a live virtual event, Sumit Madan, MD, broke down the use of quadruplet therapies in the frontline setting for patients with multiple myeloma and how to care for patients when they relapse on treatment.

tweets.text:
Is it fair for us to politely ask (without disrespecting the people being interviewed) who pays @TargetedOnc for this content?

Is it fair to ask them to report money they received from Karyopharm (if any) for this?

https://t.co/lY1whIeggs

@ManniMD1 I'm a myeloma coach and humble student of this complex disease, but why would anyone who is only intermediate risk smoldering subject themselves to the potential side effects of this drug?? Only serves Karyopharm's interest in increasing market share.

The U Chicago Leukemia/myeloid program Twitter account is up and running! Give it a follow at @UChicagoLeuk

@myeloidmalig @AyaOncologist @michaelwd  @CanerSaygin @RoloffGreg @HowellJollyBody @mariamtn89 @gvencut1

The fact 20,000 people are tuning into a discussion on whether we ought to treat smoldering myeloma is incredible. 👇👇 Twitter is really a powerful force. I hope it continues to improve :) https://t.co/KiX8sHXVJy
@AaronGoodman33 @BrownHospMed You need a better conditioner
@AaronGoodman33 @BrownHospMed Thats a variant.

A 60-year-old man presented with a 6-month history of fatigue, weight loss, and gingival bleeding. Physical examination suggested the presence of a massively enlarged spleen. Labs w/ thrombocytopenia and lymphocytosis. What is the likely diagnosis? #Medtwitter https://t.co/cDE8Os23wh
Now on the audio feed @Plenary_Session! https://t.co/eqgQ6iPtPd
Why I love Twitter… https://t.co/3Dz9YDwTVC

Wow! Great new video series from Vinay !
I enjoyed it a lot !

Med Twitter is alive, for sure !
Well done 👏 https://t.co/sdrdvtEjvK
We are hiring!!! We are looking to add to our lovely Breast Medical Oncology Team @UCSDCancer if you are interested please let me know!

Plenary Session Downloads are Insane
Millions of downloads & growing
Most Popular Heme Onc Podcast Globally
Thanks to the listeners!
@VPrasadMDMPH https://t.co/aZBkb3BvVp

A Twitter Battle on Treating HR Risk Smoldering Myeloma
I break down the debate and arguments
A 3 part video series just in time for #ASH22
(a clearer video uploading to Youtube, will post link at end of video)
@Plenary_Session @AaronGoodman33 
PART 1 - The battle starts https://t.co/MhLvKAXP29

No one is forcing you to treat HRSMM. An expert in the field presented  his reasoning. I don’t treat HR SMM-stop with the patriarchal approach to Medicine. 
Discuss data with the patient and let them make a decision. Every day is a rant on why  someone else’s approach is wrong. https://t.co/sRtYz7WxIi

Congrats to @MRLitzow @SelinaLugerMD @MartinTallman E. Paietta , Z.Sun & the rest of @eaonc team! This trial is one that keeps on giving, including 👌🏻knowledge on the biology of B-ALL also from samples collected from pts on this trial thanks to @CMullighan and team. #ASH22 https://t.co/F7GUXBE9Th

This study should be our role model in myeloma #mmsm 
✅amending protocol to give a new standard of care proven to be helpful after starting study
✅Not complaining about it (doing whats best for pts)
✅doing this in a disease less common than myeloma
And excellent results 👇 https://t.co/0H8zHvXm1d
@AaronGoodman33 @GuiperiniMD Can I be there in case the exchange turns violent?
@AaronGoodman33 Ha ha this looks exactly like a granuloma pic I posted on wikimedia commons 🔥🔥🔥

@AaronGoodman33 @MartinTallman Is there a particular regimen that are you using for older patients with B or T ALL? For a moment we had Ewall-INO for B-ALL, but out protocol patients are very challenging (for T-ALL maybe miniHCVD+Venetoclax - ASH2021?)
@AaronGoodman33 Nitroblue tetrazolium test --> some brick red colouration

@AaronGoodman33 @MartinTallman Definitely practice changing. For Ph- B-ALL these data are QUITE impressive as far as OS that far out.

I do wonder if using a more sensitive MRD panel such as clonoseq (given the more than 0.01% sensitivity) has an impact on need for blina in all settings
